node.title: 'Trying to breathe, but you can't': Travis Scott fans describe deadly concert crush
node.description: Eyewitnesses describe the pandemonium that unfolded in the crowd of rapper Travis Scott's Astroworld concert as at least eight people were killed in a sudden crushing incident.

node.title: Still cool in summer: How passive solar ideas inspired a 1950s builder ahead of his time
node.description: This suburban home in Perth's northern suburb of Yokine doesn't look much different from others on the street, but it was built in 1955 using solar design principles that have stood the test of time.

node.title: Syphilis contact tracers overwhelmed as infection spreads
node.description: While attention remains fixed on COVID-19, another, much older disease has been making a rapid resurgence, especially in remote Western Australia.

node.title: Rallies in Glasgow and Sydney call for 'survival of humanity' in face of climate change
node.description: Tens of thousands gather in Scotland's largest city and around the world calling for greater action on climate change as the COP26 conference continues.

node.title: 'Dignity in their last few days': Medically assisted dying now legal
node.description: From today, medically assisted dying is legal in Aotearoa but doctors are warning people may not be able to use it straight away.

node.title: Smile back on face of Redbacks cricketer who 'headbutted' propeller in fishing accident
node.description: Tim Oakley knew with "half his face hanging off" he was in trouble as he swam for help off the Adelaide coast on a winter's day. He would end up getting 55 stitches.

node.title: How to watch U.F.C. 268 or Canelo Álvarez vs. Caleb Plant.
node.description: The fights are available on a variety of streaming services and from other television providers.

node.title: Mark Glaze, Influential Gun Control Advocate, Dies at 51
node.description: As the executive director of Everytown for Gun Safety, he took on the National Rifle Association and helped make gun violence a winning issue.

node.title: Scores dead after tanker explosion in Sierra Leone
node.description: The accident happened after the tanker collided with another vehicle in the nation's capital, Freetown.

node.title: Kevin McCarthy Faces Republican Attacks After Failing to Stop Infrastructure Bill's Passage
node.description: Last week, he said he would "expect few, if any, to vote for it, if it comes to the floor today." On Friday, 13 GOP House members did.

node.title: Labour Party to vote on proposal to change system of electing new leader
node.description: The Labour Party is holding its first conference since its landslide win in the 2020 election.

node.title: Appeals court halts COVID vaccine mandate for larger businesses
node.description: Solicitor of Labor Seema Nanda said the U.S. Department of Labor is "confident in its legal authority to issue the emergency temporary standard on vaccination and testing."

node.title: Teachers withdraw as vaccination deadline looms
node.description: A school in New South Wales' Byron Bay region is bracing for the loss of a third of its staff, as a government-imposed vaccination deadline looms.

node.title: Victoria records 1,173 new local COVID-19 cases and nine deaths
node.description: There are now 16,413 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 361 people have died during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Victorian MP Tim Smith to quit politics after drink-driving crash
node.description: Victorian MP Tim Smith announces he will not contest next year’s state election, a week after his licence was suspended for drink-driving.

node.title: Eight killed after crowd surge at US music festival
node.description: At least eight people have died and scores of people have been hurt after a crowd surge on the opening night of a music festival in Houston, Texas.

node.title: Officials' decisions 'so far detached' from reality - Efeso Collins
node.description: The government's process for dealing with people in self-isolation is not practical, says an Auckland councillor.

node.title: Nothing Focuses the Mind Like an Electoral Drubbing
node.description: The bipartisan infrastructure bill has passed. Now it's time for Democratic centrists to make a good-faith deal on the Build Back Better bill.

node.title: Chicago Blackhawks Fire Coaches Amid Rough Start, Chaos of Sexual Assault Scandal
node.description: "It has been an extremely difficult couple of weeks...we have had to come to terms with a number of necessary changes," the team said Saturday.

node.title: Devonport remembers 'kind soul' shot dead, as 'vulnerable' children receive counselling
node.description: Friends and family remember Devonport shooting victim Chris Walters as a "kind soul", as attention turns to the welfare of the children who police say were present at the apparent murder suicide tragedy.

node.title: 'Master of my own destiny': Why this conservative town is embracing a radical renewables program
node.description: The historic wheat and sheep farming town of Katanning is embarking on a community energy project to change not just how it gets electricity, but who gets the money.

node.title: All the coronavirus news you need from across Australia
node.description: Darwin and Katherine enter day three of their snap lockdown and lockout, while Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria await their latest numbers. Live updates.

node.title: The Wallabies are about to face the biggest challenge yet to their current unbeaten run
node.description: The Wallabies are set to face a bullish Scotland in Edinburgh, in a showdown that shapes as the biggest threat to their current winning streak.

node.title: For adults and children on the spectrum, getting a COVID-19 vaccine is easier said than done
node.description: Peta was able to get her COVID-19 vaccine at a mass vaccination site easily. But when her son became eligible for the vaccine, she knew it would be a different story altogether.

node.title: From a dystopian thriller to one of the year's most anticipated novels: November's best books
node.description: A literary giant's better-than-fiction diaries and the latest novel from Burial Rites author Hannah Kent are among our book critics' top picks for the month.

node.title: Costa Rica issues COVID-19 vaccine requirement for children over five
node.description: Costa Rica becomes one of the first countries in the world to adopt a requirement for younger children to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

node.title: There's been a huge spike in injured and unwell turtles in south-east Queensland — but it's hard to work out why
node.description: Turtle rehabilitation centres say a large number of animals have required medical assistance this year, with many suffering from "floating syndrome", which can have a number of causes.

node.title: Thinking about living off-grid? Pam and Peter have been doing it for 40 years
node.description: As world leaders make promises to act on climate change, Pam and Peter Garton have been quietly making their own contribution — living off-grid for 40 years in a 'solar village' experiment.

node.title: Donald Trump Beats Joe Biden in Latest 2024 Election Poll
node.description: If they were to go head-to-head in 2024, the former president is slightly favored with 45 percent against Biden's 43.

node.title: Aucklanders can travel over summer: 'That's a commitment' - PM
node.description: Aucklanders will be able to travel outside the region over summer and Christmas, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern confirmed today.

node.title: Inside the science: Are you getting the most out of your sport supplements?
node.description: Australians spend billions of dollars per year on supplements, but are they worth parting with your hard-earned for?

node.title: Fears of dual disaster crisis as north Queensland stares down COVID and cyclone risks
node.description: Health authorities fear north Queensland could be at risk of dual emergencies as the region braces for an influx of COVID-19 cases as borders open during what could be unusually active cyclone season.

node.title: 'We are left off the map': Govt urged to do something about housing crisis in Tasmania's north-west
node.description: Rochelle Gordon has had to postpone knee replacement surgery three times due to her public housing unit being in no state for her recovery — her story is just one of many, amid pleas for something to be done about Tasmania's public housing crisis.

node.title: Farmers don't want powerlines on their land, but to get to net zero, more need to be built
node.description: The Castle's Darryl Kerrigan reckons powerlines are a reminder of man's ability to generate electricity. And as Australia ambles towards a net zero future, we're going to need a lot more.

node.title: Future of Sydney's Chinatown 'hanging by a thread' with claims historic area has been forgotten
node.description: It’s one of Sydney’s best-known areas, but the pandemic has left Chinatown struggling to survive. The closure of some iconic restaurants has prompted desperate calls for help.

node.title: Why Chinese citizens support COVID-zero even if it means being cut off from family
node.description: China now has fewer officially reported COVID-19 cases than Australia, and many Chinese citizens believe maintaining "COVID zero" by keeping its international borders closed is the only way to protect them — even if it means they continue to be separated from family.

node.title: Does Australia need an 'anti-scam centre' to fight phone scammers? Labor thinks so
node.description: Labor wants to target social media companies profiting from scammers and establish a national anti-scam centre, as part of a proposed crackdown on dangerous and annoying calls from fraudsters.

node.title: US lawmakers approve $1tn in infrastructure spending
node.description: The US Congress has passed a landmark $US1tn infrastructure spending package, delivering a major domestic win to President Joe Biden.

node.title: Pharmac grows stock of drugs to treat Covid-19
node.description: Pharmac is growing increasingly confident it is getting close to having enough of the drugs needed to treat Covid-19.

node.title: ‘No Way Out’: A Sudden Life-and-Death Struggle at a Houston Concert
node.description: Eight people died at Travis Scott’s Astroworld festival, and hundreds more were injured as investigators sought to determine why and how a surging crowd turned deadly.

node.title: Court temporarily blocks Biden’s vaccine mandate for large companies.
node.description: A federal appeals court in Louisiana granted a temporary stay to a group of businesses, religious groups, and several states who argued in a joint petition that the administration overstepped its authority.

node.title: Videos Show Fans Chanting 'Stop the Show' as Astroworld Music Fest Turns Deadly
node.description: "Saw unconscious bodies being DRAGGED out of the mosh pits while the show continued. Horrifying and heartbreaking," a person tweeted.

node.title: Appeals Court Freezes Biden Vaxx Mandate for Businesses Amid 'Abuse of Authority' Claims
node.description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit said that the COVID vaccine mandate for companies has "grave statutory and constitutional issues."

node.title: A father and son's Ice Age plot to slow Siberian thaw
node.description: Sergey and Nikita Zimov are trying to engineer an ice age ecosystem by introducing bison, horses and camels to a Siberian nature reserve. Peer-reviewed scientific papers show they are slowing global warming.

node.title: Macron often hides behind 'a seductive facade'. Now Australia's getting a glimpse of the savvy fighter
node.description: Just four years ago, Emmanuel Macron used a photo op to show the world's most powerful leader he would not be pushed around. It was an early insight into the French leader's blunt diplomacy.

node.title: How to fly long haul, stay safe from COVID and actually be comfortable
node.description: As we dare to make travel plans, experts offer advice on how to assess the risk fo COVID-19 and stay safe in the sky.

node.title: Vink wraps up Tour of Southland win
node.description: Cantabrian Michael Vink has ridden his way into New Zealand cycling's history books on the final day of the Tour of Southland.

node.title: Wisconsin health care group and Aaron Rodgers end partnership
node.description: Rodgers said on Friday he had taken an unproven anti-parasite drug instead of getting vaccinated against COVID.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Petitions for Monthly $2K Payments Nears 4 Million Signatures
node.description: Collectively, the seven petitions have drawn over 3,913,400 signatures and continued to receive support over the weekend.

node.title: Archaeologists find 'slaves' room' in Pompeii villa
node.description: Italy's culture minister, Dario Franceschini, says the find is an "important discovery" that enriches knowledge of "the level of society still little known".

node.title: Biden finally seals the deal on $1 trillion infrastructure package
node.description: US President Joe Biden hails the passage of his trillion-dollar infrastructure package as a "monumental step forward for the nation" after fellow Democrats resolved a months-long standoff in their ranks to finally seal the deal.

node.title: 'Slow-motion car accident on repeat': Diplomats uneasy as France-Australia relationship takes a nosedive
node.description: While some diplomats sympathise with France's position, others worry there are much bigger concerns at play — like regional security in the Indo-Pacific.

node.title: Cleo Smith's case touched the nation. But not all missing children's cases will have the same outcome
node.description: When Cleo Smith was found, a collective sigh of relief was felt across the country. Sadly, not all who are searching for their missing children will experience the same outcome. Warning: This story contains the name and image of a deceased Indigenous person.

node.title: GOP Lawmaker Backs Biden's Infrastructure Bill to Own the Squad: 'I Voted Against AOC'
node.description: Republican Congresswoman Nicole Malliotakis predicted that the president's larger Build Back Better bill may now "die altogether" in the Senate.

node.title: How I Became Extremely Open-Minded
node.description: Fighting for my health, I went to the fringe without rejecting the center.

node.title: In Infrastructure Votes, 19 Members Broke With Their Party
node.description: The defectors who crossed partisan lines in Congress include 13 Republicans who supported the bill and the six liberal members of “The Squad,” who opposed it.

node.title: Biden Celebrates Infrastructure Win, Even if Harder Victory Is Ahead
node.description: “Finally! Infrastructure week!” the president declared with a broad smile.

node.title: Australia thrashes West Indies to reach Men's T20 World Cup semis
node.description: Australia qualifies for the T20 World Cup semi-finals as opening batsman David Warner scores an unbeaten 89 to secure victory with 22 balls to spare in Abu Dhabi.

node.title: Tens of thousands march outside U.N. climate summit in Glasgow
node.description: Climate protests were also held across Europe, including in London, Paris, Dublin, Copenhagen, Zurich and Istanbul.

node.title: Ministry of Health won't give WOCA Māori vaccine data it wants
node.description: Ministry of Health says it will not be sharing Māori vaccination data with Whānau Ora Commissioning Agency at the scale the agency wants.

node.title: On the Scene: Climate Protests
node.description: The protests related to COP26, the United Nations climate summit, peaked on Friday and Saturday, drawing tens of thousands of people to Glasgow’s streets.

node.title: ‘A Daily Cloud of Suffering’: A Crackdown in China Is Felt Abroad
node.description: As Uyghurs grapple with the emotional trauma of their families suffering back in Xinjiang, some are overcoming a cultural stigma to seek out counseling.

node.title: Travis Scott 'Devastated' About Astroworld Deaths, Attendees Describe Concert as 'Hell'
node.description: "More people began screaming for help, but we were not heard," one attendee wrote on social media about the deadly event in Houston.

node.title: Bear Takes Dip in Pool, Roams Through Yards as Neighborhood Warned to Stay Indoors
node.description: "I see a bear jump in the pool and I told my buddy, 'Hey, I gotta get off the phone. I gotta film this,'" a neighborhood resident said.

node.title: Man missing after shark attack in Western Australia
node.description: Water police and rescue helicopters are searching for a man after a shark attack off Port Beach in Fremantle, Perth.

node.title: Inflation - what it means and should we worry
node.description: The Detail - Emile Donovan sits down with NZ Herald business editor-at-large Liam Dann for a bit of Inflation 101: why it exists, how it works and why it matters.

node.title: Black Caps inch closer to T20 World Cup semifinals
node.description: New Zealand is one win away from the final four after Glenn Phillips and Jimmy Neesham propel them to 52-run victory over Namibia.

node.title: Boeing directors agree to $237.5M settlement on 737 Maxs
node.description: Boeing directors have reached a proposed settlement with shareholders over safety oversights on the 737 Max aircraft, documents show.

node.title: Live Updates: Travis Scott "devastated" after 8 died at Astroworld music festival
node.description: The "mass casualty incident" occurred after 9 p.m. when a crowd began to "compress" toward the front of the stage, authorities said.

node.title: Democrats Thought They Bottomed Out in Rural, White America. It Wasn’t the Bottom.
node.description: Republicans ran up the margins in rural Virginia counties, the latest sign that Democrats, as one lawmaker put it, “continue to tank in small-town America.”

node.title: Teacher Removed After Telling 8th Graders Trump Still President, Vaccines Dangerous
node.description: "He also had child pornography on his laptop," the unnamed teacher allegedly claimed about Hunter Biden. "He was having sexual intercourse with his own niece."

node.title: All Blacks: Another Roman Holiday but dark clouds on the horizon
node.description: It's been 30 years since Italy got the closest they ever have to the All Blacks, but that isn't going to happen early tomorrow morning in Rome, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Tomb of the Unknown Soldier opening to public for first time in decades
node.description: The area will be open to the public for the two-day event happening on November 9 and 10 at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia.

node.title: Americans Are Flush With Cash and Jobs. They Also Think the Economy Is Awful.
node.description: The psychological effects of inflation seem to have the upper hand.

node.title: The Congressional Black Caucus Was Key to the Infrastructure Vote
node.description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi sent the chairwoman of the caucus, Representative Joyce Beatty of Ohio, to announce a key deal, understanding that the lawmaker had more influence at that point than she did.

node.title: Foreman Says Military Jury Was Disgusted by C.I.A. Torture
node.description: A Navy captain whose letter recommended clemency for a Qaeda terrorist drafted the damning two-page document in 20 minutes.

node.title: Georgia Grand Jury Looms in Trump Inquiry
node.description: An Atlanta D.A. is said to be likely to impanel a special grand jury in her criminal investigation of election interference by the former president and his allies.

node.title: F.B.I. Searches James O’Keefe’s Home in Ashley Biden Diary Theft Inquiry
node.description: Authorities carried out a court-ordered search at the New York apartment of the Project Veritas founder two days after searching the homes of his associates.

node.title: Bill Maher Defends Parents Objecting to Critical Race Theory, Says Kids 'Traumatized'
node.description: "We're talking about kids who seem to be too young sometimes to fully appreciate all this," the 'Real Time' host said Friday.

node.title: China State Media: 'Military Showdown Will Come' if Taiwan, U.S. Don't Change Course
node.description: The Chinese Communist Party publication said tensions could lead to "a life-and-death struggle" forcing the U.S. to sacrifice "the lives of Americans."

node.title: Naked Man Found Trapped in Theater's Bathroom Crawlspace After Being Stuck for Days
node.description: Mike Intaglietta, executive director of the Landmark Theatre, said that employees had noticed the man wandering around the building earlier in the week.

node.title: Book excerpt: "Madam," the story of renowned brothel owner Polly Adler
node.description: A new biography by Pulitzer Prize-winner Debby Applegate traces the rise and fall of an icon of the Prohibition Era.

node.title: This Is What Africa Needs Right Now
node.description: World leaders must seize the moral imperative and commit to action on climate change.

node.title: Big Kid Vaccines Are Here!
node.description: Rejoicing (mostly) ensues.

node.title: Body Shaming Dressed Up as a Fitness Goal Is Still Body Shaming
node.description: When women are urged to change their bodies to perform, is it really about aesthetics?

node.title: The Way We Work Now (or Don’t)
node.description: Ways of thinking about work, and antiwork. Also: Is Facebook being prejudged?

node.title: GOP Rep. Gonzalez Issues Warning on Trump: U.S. 'Can't Survive Torching the Constitution'
node.description: "January 6th was an unconstitutional attempt led by the president of the United States to overturn an American election and reinstall himself in power illegitimately," he said of Donald Trump.

node.title: Activists hope protests will draw large crowds as leaders haggle in Glasgow.
node.description: By Dan Bilefsky and Megan Specia

node.title: US Secretary of State orders probe into 'Havana Syndrome'
node.description: The US State Department has named a new coordinator for its investigation into cases of so-called Havana Syndrome, responding to increased pressure to investigate and respond to hundreds of brain injuries reported by diplomats and intelligence officers.

node.title: A Woke-Up Call for Democrats
node.description: Out of chaos comes just more chaos.

node.title: COP26 Protesters Back an Array of Causes, Connected by Climate Change
node.description: Thousands gathered in the rain in Glasgow to press the case for more urgent and meaningful action by world leaders in response to global warming.

node.title: Russia Hits Record Daily COVID Cases Despite Enforced Holiday to Curb Disease
node.description: President Vladimir Putin declared a holiday from October 30 to November 7 but the infection numbers continue to rise.

node.title: GOP Rep. Adam Kinzinger Mocks Marjorie Taylor Greene for Calling Infrastructure Communism
node.description: "Eisenhower's interstate system should be torn up or else the commies will be able to conveniently drive!" the Ilinois Republican congressman quipped.

node.title: Professors Sue University After Being Barred From Testifying Against DeSantis Voting Law
node.description: In a reversal Friday, the University of Florida announced that it would allow the professors to provide testimony as long as they did so on their own time and without using school resources.

node.title: High Schoolers Barred From Hockey Games After Crudely Taunting a Goalie
node.description: After students at a Pennsylvania high school yelled sexually explicit chants at a visiting team’s only female player, the entire student body was barred from games for the rest of the season.

node.title: Aaron Rodgers says he is unvaccinated and takes ivermectin
node.description: Rodgers, 37, lashed out at the media, the NFL's rules on COVID-19 testing and said he consulted with podcaster Joe Rogan for alternatives to the vaccine.

node.title: What Do You Want to Know About Kids and Vaccines?
node.description: The Times is hosting a live chat with a pediatric infectious disease specialist and two reporters about the coronavirus vaccine and children. We’d like to hear your questions.

node.title: Costa Rica moves to require Covid shots for children.
node.description: The Central American nation’s health ministry said on Friday it was adding Covid-19 to the list of required vaccinations for people 18 and younger.

node.title: Fire in Covid intensive care ward kills 11 people in India.
node.description: Staff at the hospital in the western state of Maharashtra tried to douse the fire with fire extinguishers, but the flames spread quickly in the airtight room.

node.title: Facing a spike in infections, Austria sharpens the rules of its Covid pass.
node.description: Austrians will need proof of vaccination or a past infection to be seated at a restaurant, enter a bar, visit a hairdresser or join any gathering of more than 25 people.
